H0.text: who conducted the opening concert at carnegie hall. Gustav Mahler

H1.text: who conducted the opening concert at carnegie hall. Anton Seidl

H2.text: who conducted the opening concert at carnegie hall. Victor Herbert

H3.text: who conducted the opening concert at carnegie hall. Walter Damrosch

A4.text: The Music Hall officially opened on May 5, 1891, with a rendition of the Old 100th hymn, a speech by Episcopal bishop Henry C. Potter, and a concert conducted by Walter Damrosch and Russian composer Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky.
